Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: curlicue \curl"i*cue\ (k?rl"?-k?), n. [Cf. F. caracole.] Some thing curled or spiral, as a flourish made with a pen on paper, or with skates on the ice; a trick; a frolicsome caper. [Sometimes written {curlycue} or {carlicue}.] [ Colloq. U.S.] [1913 Webster]
curlicue n 1: a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles [syn: {coil}, {whorl}, {roll}, {curl}, {ringlet}, {gyre}, {scroll}] 2: a short twisting line [syn: {squiggle}]
